title: 108_s1898
content: The Act titled "Voluntary Support for Reservists and National Guard Members Act" designates overpayments to support reservists under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Act allows individuals to designate a portion of their tax overpayment to the Reservist Income Differential Trust Fund when filing their tax return. The designation must be made at the time of filing and will be treated as refunded for tax purposes. The text chunk discusses the process of designating a portion of tax overpayment to the Reservist Income Differential Trust Fund. The Secretary of the Treasury is responsible for transferring the designated amounts to the fund. Additionally, a clerical amendment is made to the Internal Revenue Code. Designation of overpayments to support reservists includes creating the Reservist Income Differential Trust Fund under the Internal Revenue Code. Establishment of the Reservist Income Differential Trust Fund in the Treasury of the United States to support eligible members of reserve components with distributions in accordance with section 212 of title 37, United States Code. SEC. 3. PAY DIFFERENTIAL FOR MOBILIZED RESERVES. Effective dates: Subsection (a) applies to taxable years after December 31, 2003, and subsection (b) takes effect upon enactment of this Act. Sec. 212 of title 37, United States Code, authorizes the payment of a pay differential to eligible members of a reserve component serving on active duty for more than 30 days in support of a contingency operation. The amount of the pay differential is determined based on specific criteria outlined in the section. The pay differential under section 212 of title 37, United States Code, for a member on active duty is calculated based on their previous monthly compensation compared to their basic pay for the month of active duty. The Secretary concerned has the discretion to adjust the pay amount. The pay differential for members on active duty is determined based on their previous monthly compensation compared to their basic pay. The Secretary concerned may adjust the amount if necessary. Members cannot receive more than $25,000 under this section. Funding for pay differentials comes from the Reservist Income Differential Trust Fund, with regulations prescribed by the Secretaries of Defense and Treasury for fund transfers. The Reservist Income Differential Trust Fund is defined as the fund referred to in this section. The Reservist Income Differential Trust Fund, defined in the Internal Revenue Code, is the source of funding for pay differentials for members on active duty. Regulations for fund transfers are determined by the Secretaries of Defense and Treasury. Section 212 of title 37, United States Code, regarding reserves on active duty, will be effective on October 1, 2004, applying to months starting on or after that date.
